title: Arcana aulica, or, Walsingham's manual of prudential maxims for the states-man and the courtier
author: Refuge, Eustache de, d. 1617.
publisher: Printed for James Yong, and are to be sold by John Williams...,
notes: Translated into English by Edward Walsingham from a French manuscript copy of the second part of Trait√© de la cour, ou, Instruction des courtisans. The authorship of this work has generally been attributed to Sir Francis Walsingham, but the original was a French work by Eustache Du Refuge and was first published anonymously in Paris in 1617.  Cf. DNB; Brunet.
Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
